abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Technical Training
            Project in Republic of Yemen are as follows: overall outcome
            of the project was rated unsatisfactory, and the performance
            of the Bank and the Borrower were rated satisfactory.
            Lessons learned from the project are: it is very difficult
            to implement a project during a period of externally
            generated administrative changes and major political
            instability. Careful attention should be given to project
            implementation arrangements for civil works at the
            preparation stage, especially to the acquisition of land for
            new buildings. Effectiveness conditions can unnecessarily
            delay project start up. Urgent actions should be executed by
            Government upfront (before negotiations or Board
            Presentation) rather than as a condition of effectiveness.
            Simple procurement procedures transparently applied should
            be followed by the Borrower to facilitate the award of tenders.
